member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.StaticConfigurationManager`1
member.summary: This type is for users that want a fixed and static Configuration. In this case, the configuration is obtained and passed to the constructor.

member.summary: Interface that defines a model for retrieving configuration data.

member.summary: Retrieve the current configuration, refreshing and/or caching as needed. This should throw if the configuration cannot be retrieved, instead of returning null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.IConfigurationManager`1.RequestRefresh
member.summary: Indicate that the configuration may be stale (as indicated by failing to process incoming tokens).

member.summary: For the this type, this is a no-op

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1
member.summary: Manages the retrieval of Configuration data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.DefaultAutomaticRefreshInterval
member.summary: 5 days is the default time interval that afterwards, will obtain new configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.DefaultRefreshInterval
member.summary: 30 seconds is the default time interval that must pass for to obtain a new configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.MinimumAutomaticRefreshInterval
member.summary: 5 minutes is the minimum value for automatic refresh. can not be set less than this value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.MinimumRefreshInterval
member.summary: 1 second is the minimum time interval that must pass for to obtain new configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Instantiaties a new that manages automatic and controls refreshing on configuration data.

member.summary: Instantiaties a new that manages automatic and controls refreshing on configuration data.
member.param: the client to use when obtaining configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.IDocumentRetriever)
member.summary: Instantiaties a new that manages automatic and controls refreshing on configuration data.
member.param: the that reaches out to obtain the configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.GetConfigurationRetriever
member.summary: Gets the current that is used to obtain configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.GetConfigurationAsync
member.summary: Obtains an updated version of Configuration.
member.remarks: If the time since the last call is less than then is not called and the current Configuration is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.GetConfigurationAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Obtains an updated version of Configuration.
member.remarks: If the time since the last call is less than then is not called and the current Configuration is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.RequestRefresh
member.summary:
Requests that then next call to obtain new configuration.
if the last refresh was greater than then the next call to will retrieve new configuration.
if == then this method is essentially an no-op.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.AutomaticRefreshInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the that controls how often an automatic metadata refresh should occur.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.RefreshInterval
member.summary: The minimum time between retrievals, in the event that a retrieval failed, or that a refresh was explicitly requested.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator
member.summary: OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator can be used to ensure that a that was obtained using openidconnect is compliant with http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDToken .

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.DefaultNonceLifetime
member.summary: Default for the how long the nonce is valid.
member.remarks: default: 1 hour.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of ,

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.GenerateNonce
member.summary: Generates a value suitable to use as a nonce.
member.remarks:
if is true then the 'nonce' will contain the Epoch time as the prefix, seperated by a '.'.
for example: 635410359229176103.MjQxMzU0ODUtMTdiNi00NzAwLWE4MjYtNTE4NGExYmMxNTNlZmRkOGU4NjctZjQ5OS00MWIyLTljNTEtMjg3NmM0NzI4ZTc5

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.Validate(System.IdentityModel.Tokens.JwtSecurityToken,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that a is valid as per http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
member.exception: if the is missing any required claims as per: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDToken
member.remarks: and will be validated if they are non-null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateCHash(System.IdentityModel.Tokens.JwtSecurityToken,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the 'authorizationCode' according to http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html section 3.3.2.10.
member.param: a with a 'c_hash' claim that must match . If is null, the check is not made.
member.exception: if the 'c_hash' claim does not match as per http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#CodeValidation .
if the hash algorithm defined in (default is JwtAlgorithms.RSA_SHA256) was unable to be created.
if the creation of the hash algorithm return a null instance.
member.remarks: if is null, then the 'c_hash' will not be validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.ValidateNonce(System.IdentityModel.Tokens.JwtSecurityToken,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates that the contains the nonce.
member.param: a with a 'nonce' claim that must match .
a that contains the 'nonce' to validate.
member.exception: if a'nonce' is not found in the and RequireNonce is true.
if is null and RequireNonce is true.
if the 'nonce' found in the doesn't match .
if is true and a timestamp is not: found, well formed, negatire or expired.
member.remarks:
The timestamp is only validated if is true.
If is not-null, then a matching 'nonce' must exist in the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.HashAlgorithmMap
member.summary: Gets the algorithm mapping between OpenIdConnect and .Net for Hash algorithms. a that contains mappings from the JWT namespace http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-algorithms-26 to .Net.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.NonceLifetime
member.summary: Gets or set the defining how long a nonce is valid.
member.exception: if 'value' is less than or equal to 'TimeSpan.Zero'.
member.remarks: if is true, then the nonce timestamp is bound by DateTime.UtcNow + NonceLifetime.
